title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 195.3 - Classification and size limitations of authorized signs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 195.3 - Classification and size limitations of authorized signs

State Regulations

Authorized signs shall be classified and limited in size
according to the outside height and width or the total area of one side
thereof, exclusive of the necessary supporting structure, as follows: (a) Standard small: a sign one foot high by
three feet wide. (b) Small: a sign
not exceeding three square feet in area. (c) Standard medium: a sign 2 1/2 feet high
by four feet wide. (d) Medium: a
sign not exceeding 10 square feet in area. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
195.3

Authorized signs may be lettered on both
sides. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
